title: [K-12] Language Competency (Reading, Writing, Expression, Grammar) Enhancement Course Using MOOC-Based Self-Regulated Learning and Social Mirroring

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency (reading, writing, speaking) and experience with digital devices, understanding of fundamental grammatical structures (parts of speech, tenses, sentence structure), and ability to perform simple text analysis
context.additional_context: VR environment configuration to promote social interaction among learners and visualization tools for individual learning progress. Focuses on text-based collaborative activities (joint writing/feedback exchange) and expressive skills enhancement (pronunciation, intonation, fluency) through voice feedback. Provides exemplary case videos and peer assessment rubrics for social mirroring.

learning_goals: Learners monitor peer language task progress (text analysis·vocabulary frequency) in VR simulation environments, apply self-regulated learning strategies (time management·goal setting) ≥1 time/week, and establish vocabulary expansion plans (≥20 domain-specific terms) based on feedback.

Using social mirroring scaffolding (role model observation·imitation, peer feedback sharing), learners perform weekly language tasks (text structure analysis·writing·presentations) over 8 weeks, revise strategies reflecting ≥3 peer feedback points (clarity of expression·grammatical accuracy·logical flow), and reduce grammatical errors by ≥30% compared to pre-assessments.

By the end of the 6-month course, learners demonstrate social awareness (active listening·empathic responses·role division) at ≥3 on a 4-point rubric scale during collaboration in ≥3 project-based assessments (team language presentations·role-plays·joint reports), while maintaining logical coherence (topic consistency·evidence provision·clarity of conclusions) in presentation content.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
